intro: Plagiosiphon gabonensis, commonly known as the Gabon siphon, is a flowering plant native to Central Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its striking violet to purple flowers, which are typically borne on slender, hairy stems. Its leaves are usually alternate, ovate, and have a rough texture. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests.
